name: 2-chloro-1-phenylsulfonamidobenzene
source: RAEVSKY OA; PERLOVICH GL and SCHAPER K-J. Physicochemical properties/descriptors governing the solubility and partitioning of chemicals in water-solvent-gas systems. Part 2. Solubility in 1-octanol. SAR and QSAR in Environmental Research Vol. 18 Nos. 5–6 July–September 2007 543–578
Reason: The compound 2-chloro-1-phenylsulfonamidobenzene has a basic benzene structure with a melting point of 5.5°C. The chlorine atom adds a significant increase to the melting point due to the strong intermolecular forces between chlorine atoms. The sulfonamide group can form hydrogen bonds, which tend to increase the melting point. The phenyl group can participate in pi-pi interactions, which can also increase the melting point. The sulfur atom can form sulfur-nitrogen bonds, which can also increase the melting point. The presence of multiple functional groups can lead to a synergistic effect, increasing the melting point.
